at line 23
static string joinAnd(array|Traversable $list, string $width = '', string $locale = '')

Concatenates a list of items returning a localized string using "and" as seperator.

For instance, array(1, 2, 3) will result in '1, 2, and 3' for English or '1, 2 e 3' for Italian.

Parameters

array|Traversable $list The list to concatenate
string $width The preferred width ('' for default, or 'short' or 'narrow')
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

Return Value

string returns an empty string if $list is not an array of it it's empty, the joined items otherwise

at line 39
static string joinOr(array|Traversable $list, string $width = '', string $locale = '')

Concatenates a list of items returning a localized string using "or" as seperator.

For instance, array(1, 2, 3) will result in '1, 2, or 3' for English or '1, 2 o 3' for Italian.

Parameters

array|Traversable $list The list to concatenate
string $width The preferred width ('' for default, or 'short' or 'narrow')
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

Return Value

string returns an empty string if $list is not an array of it it's empty, the joined items otherwise

at line 55
static string joinUnits(array|Traversable $list, string $width = '', string $locale = '')

Concatenates a list of unit items returning a localized string.

For instance, array('3 ft', '2 in') will result in '3 ft, 2 in'.

Parameters

array|Traversable $list The list to concatenate
string $width The preferred width ('' for default, or 'short' or 'narrow')
string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

Return Value

string returns an empty string if $list is not an array of it it's empty, the joined items otherwise

at line 74
static string fixCase(string $string, string $case)

Fix the case of a string.

Parameters

string $string The string whose case needs to be fixed
string $case How to fix case. Allowed values:
  • 'titlecase-words' all words in the phrase should be title case
  • 'titlecase-firstword' the first word should be title case
  • 'lowercase-words' all words in the phrase should be lower case
    		•

    Return Value

    string

    See also

    at line 122
    static array getBrowserLocales(bool $ignoreCache = false)

    Parse the browser HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE header and return the found locales, sorted in descending order by the quality values.

    Parameters

    bool $ignoreCache Set to true if you want to ignore the cache

    Return Value

    array Array keys are the found locales, array values are the relative quality value (from 0 to 1)

    at line 145
    static array parseHttpAcceptLanguage(string $httpAcceptLanguages)

    Parse the value of an HTTP_ACCEPT_LANGUAGE header and return the found locales, sorted in descending order by the quality values.

    Parameters

    string $httpAcceptLanguages

    Return Value

    array Array keys are the found locales, array values are the relative quality value (from 0 to 1)

    static string getCharacterOrder(string $locale = '')

    Retrieve the character order (right-to-left or left-to-right).

    Parameters

    string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

    Return Value

    string Return 'left-to-right' or 'right-to-left'

    at line 257
    static protected string joinInternal(array|Traversable $list, string $type, string $width, string $locale)

    Concatenates a list of items returning a localized string.

    Parameters

    array|Traversable $list The list to concatenate
    string $type The type of list; 'standard' (e.g. '1, 2, and 3'), 'or' ('1, 2, or 3') or 'unit' ('3 ft, 2 in').
    string $width The preferred width ('' for default, or 'short' or 'narrow')
    string $locale The locale to use. If empty we'll use the default locale set in \Punic\Data

    Return Value

    string returns an empty string if $list is not an array of it it's empty, the joined items otherwise
